page.title: 13Blandford - Langton Farm
page.content: Mr.Bridges showed us around.First we went up the new stud to see the horses Mr Cowe looks after them.They bought the farm in 1979 & now have 15 horses, 8 in foal.They feed them on cake,maize oats,wheat & malt.They train the horses in a'menage'.The race horses are worth Â£\ million each. They have 34 fields & 800 acres.They have a Hereford Bull,27 beef cattle,47 young beef cattle,a dairy herd,127 in all.377.4 acres are corn.My Dad,in the Summer,works in the corn drier.Today he was spraying the fields to get the insects off the corn or grass. Sometimes he goes ploughing to turn the ground over to make it soft for the seed drill.I live on the farm & my Grandad used to be a Shepherd on Langton Farm.He lives at Scotland Cottages.We saw where my Grandad lives & where I live.{Gary Park (aged 9)
